text: in the summertime I'm always looking for
a great side dish to go with barbecue
and grilling and all of that stuff and
there's nothing better suited than
cornbread so today I'm gonna give you
guys a great simple pretty much all
purpose cornbread of course it does have
a little cheese in it so might not be
completely all-purpose but it's
completely fantastic I just combined one
cup of cornmeal and one cup of
all-purpose flour to that add three
tablespoons of sugar just a hint of
sweetness a teaspoon of coarse salt
you're using fine salt you 1/2 a
teaspoon quarter teaspoon of freshly
ground pepper you can put a little bit
of cayenne in there if you wanted to
instead of the pepper a teaspoon of
baking soda whisk together now if you're
a non cheese lover you don't want to
have cheese in here you can leave it out
you could replace about half the volume
with like diced peppers or something
like that but I like the cheese because
I like cheese in pretty much everything
once your dry ingredients are whisked do
you combine your wet ingredients this is
a cup and a half of low-fat buttermilk
and two large eggs I like to just whisk
my eggs into my buttermilk and then just
put them all in at one time into the dry
ingredients so you can go ahead and do
that too
then into your dry ingredients whisk
that's it can you believe it
cornbread is so easy one cup of shredded
cheddar cheese your choice white yellow
whatever you want as you can see this is
yellow extra sharp if you like that your
choice so the batter is ready but what I
like to do is cook this in a preheated
cast-iron skillet so I'm just gonna set
this aside for a sec and take 2
tablespoons of butter and put it into my
9-inch cast-iron skillet this needs to
keep in the oven which is already
heating at 425 degrees just until the
butter melts butter melted nice and hot
swirl it around to fully coat your pan I
mean cast-iron if it's properly seasoned
is basically nonstick any way pour your
batter in and be careful not to touch
the handle now it's really hot because
it was in the oven this really hot pan
is gonna help it puff up when it goes
right into the ovens whoo get a
beautiful full cornbread when it comes
out of the oven
and this is the perfect sized pan so
it'll be nice and deep smooth the top
and then get this right back into the
oven and bake it until a toothpick
inserted in the center comes out clean
that'll take 20 to 25 minutes golden
brown crunchy on the outside tender on
the inside you got to let it cool off a
little bit before you cut into it and
eat it as usual but you can serve it
warm or room temperature I'm gonna try
some now look isn't that nice
edges are nice and crispy and that's
because I preheated my pan with that
butter so that it sort of puffed up in
the pan right when I put it in it's such
a great technique you guys should try it
this is a super easy cornbread enjoy
you
